The physics of this situation can be explained by understanding Newton's laws of motion:

1. First Law (Law of Inertia): An object at rest tends to stay at rest, while an object in motion stays in motion with constant velocity along a straight line unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.
2. Second Law (Force = Mass x Acceleration): The acceleration of an object depends directly on the net force acting on it and inversely on its mass; i.e., Fnet = ma

In our case:
- The only significant force acting on the ball is Earth's gravitational pull towards the center of the planet (downwards).
- There seems to be no friction between the ball and ground which would oppose its downward motion.
- Assuming there are no air currents affecting the trajectory of the ball, we can safely assume that the ball will continue moving downwards until it reaches the bottom edge of the gray surface where it meets the blue cup.
